alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 9:42AM MDT until June 16 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. For the Gallatin River...including Logan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gallatin River at Logan. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.9 feet, Water into USGS gage house. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM MDT Tuesday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 06/08/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 10 am Wednesday.Wednesday morning at 900 AM MDT.
